text: The 2019–20 FC Bayern Munich season was the 121st season in the football club's history and 55th consecutive and overall season in the top flight of German football, the Bundesliga. ==Squad information== ==Transfers== ===Transfers in=== Date from Position Player Transferred from Fee 1 July 2019 DF Benjamin Pavard VfB Stuttgart Transfer €35m 1 July 2019 DF Lucas Hernandez Atlético Madrid Transfer €80m 1 July 2019 FW Fiete Arp Hamburger SV Transfer €2.5m 13 August 2019 MF Ivan Perišić Inter Milan Loan €5m 17 August 2019 MF Michaël Cuisance Borussia Mönchengladbach Transfer €10m 17 August 2019 MF Philippe Coutinho Barcelona Loan €8.5m, with an option to buyout at €120m 22 January 2020 DF Álvaro Odriozola Real Madrid Loan undisclosed ===Transfers out=== Date from Position Player Transferred to Fee 30 June 2019 MF Franck Ribéry Fiorentina released free 30 June 2019 MF Arjen Robben N/A retired free 30 June 2019 MF James Rodríguez Real Madrid loan return free 1 July 2019 DF Marco Friedl Werder Bremen transfer undisclosed 1 July 2019 DF Rafinha Flamengo transfer free 1 July 2019 DF Mats Hummels Borussia Dortmund transfer €38m 1 July 2019 FW Jeong Woo-yeong SC Freiburg transfer undisclosed 23 August 2019 MF Renato Sanches Lille transfer €25m ==Friendly matches== ==Competitions== ===Overview=== ===Bundesliga=== ====League table==== ====Results summary==== ====Results by round==== ====Matches==== The Bundesliga schedule was announced on 28 June 2019. ===DFB-Pokal=== ===DFL- Supercup=== ===UEFA Champions League=== ====Group stage==== ====Knockout phase==== ==Statistics== ===Appearances and goals=== |- !
